statics.name: fromJSON
statics.description: Creates a new grammar object from a JSON string

parameters.desc: a JSON representation of the grammar
the context for any referenced variables or functions (optional)

functions.name: addRule
functions.example:
rg = new RiGrammar();
rg.addRule("start", "animal");
rg.addRule("animal", "cat | dog | chicken");


// To add weights, specify them inline with brackets

rg.addRule("animal", "cat [4] | dog | chicken");
functions.description: Adds a rule to the existing grammar, replacing any existing rule with the same name.

functions.name: expand
functions.example:
rg = RiTa.grammar(rules);
result = rg.expand();

rg = RiTa.grammar(rules);
result = rg.expand(ruleName);

rg = RiTa.grammar(rules, context);
result = rg.expand(ruleName);
functions.description:
Expands a grammar from the supplied rule. If no rule is provided the $start and <start> symbols will be checked respectively.

If a context is needed, it should be passed in when the grammar is created (see 3rd example below).

parameters.desc: the rule name to be expanded (optional)

returns.desc: the result of the expansion (or an error if the rule is not found)

functions.name: removeRule
functions.description: Deletes the named rule from the grammar
